channel.title: Need a new broadband provider
channel.description:
Yes, my mum's received an email saying this is our final warning on [b]high download/upload limmits[/b] on [b]infinite download broadband[/b]. It says we've been downloading 1+GB at peak times yet my mum wouldn't know how to download anything 100mb+ and I only download in non peak times(3 hours in peak times but then 1GB in 3 hours on 1mb broadband :confused:). I hardly download anything and the only things that I use that are connected to the internet are msn, mirc, multiplayer games(quake 4, age of empires 3, rs) so how I'm downloading 1GB daily when just playing these games(when I download off uTorrent or somthing, our internet goes slow, when I play games, our internet isn't slow :confused: again). Yes, my rambling but read on.
Now, my mum is paying Â£17.99 for our broadband, accoring to [url=http://www.tiscali.co.uk/products/broadband/8mb-unlimited.html?code=ZZ-NL-11EE]THIS[/url] link we should have 8MB broadband, but according to [url=http://www.adslguide.org.uk/tools/speedtest.asp]THIS[/url] link, I have a slow 2MB connection, or a normal 1MB connection, so it's either tiscali.co.uk think we're dumb noobs and trying to rip us off(witch they are) or I really am downloading 1GB a day just playing RS.
I'd upgrade our broadband or even find out what broadband speed we are but my mum isn't "technical" and dosen't know what half of this is, but I know one thing, we aren't getting our monney's worth of broadband. If you know any ISP that provides 8mb broband with unlimmited download limmits, post them here. :)

Speed

6.5 megabits per second

item.title: Need a new broadband provider
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Starblaster100:

YOu live in england. Try Wanadoo, they’re not bad, i use them. I have about 7.6 - 8 Meg Broadband

Thanks. I’ll take a look.

[quote=“kmb, post:2, topic:7171”]WELL,

Bandwidth Place

Speed Test Results Explained: Download, Upload, Ping Result

Interpreting Internet speed test results upload/download, and effects on Audido/Video streaming. Test an ISP or mobile carrier, desktop, laptop or smartphone.


See the “Improve Your Bandwidth Speed” box on the left? It could work, it might be just some kind of scam, I dont quarantee you wil find a better ISP with that or anything since I dont live in the UK, but you might want to give it a go. There’s also a free speed test on that site.

EDIT: Here are my results on the speedtest link you provided:
Speed Test Results

Downstream 4,866.6 Kbps ( = 4.8 Mbps )
Upstream 762.9 Kbps ( = 0.7 Mbps )[/quote]

Here are mine:

Downstream: 193.22 Kbps (0.19 Mbps)
Upstream: 222.22 Kbps (0.22 Mbps)

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:4, topic:7171”]England ftw.

I have a big tip though - Do NOT use Tiscali. They are rubbish with Broadband. I used to use them, but they sucked. I changed to BT. BT are pretty good for the moment. Their customer service is also very good :)[/quote]

Thanks. I’ll take a look also.

Read full topic
